title: How to Save a Bing Background Image

steps.title: Visit the Bing website.
steps.content: Visit the Bing website. Open a web browser (any browser like Google Chrome or Firefox will do), and go to www.bing.com. Once the page loads, you’ll immediately see the search bar and the background image.

steps.title: Right-click anywhere on the background image.
steps.content: Right-click anywhere on the background image. This will bring out the context menu.

steps.title: Select “Inspect Element” from the menu.
steps.content: Select “Inspect Element” from the menu. Your browser’s Developer Tools will appear at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Click the “Resources” tab on the Developer Tools screen.
steps.content: Click the “Resources” tab on the Developer Tools screen. You should see a folder directory on the left-hand side panel.

steps.title: Click the “Frame” folder from this directory.
steps.content: Click the “Frame” folder from this directory. It should open to a sub-folder labeled “www.bing.com”.

steps.title: Open this sub-folder and double-click on the “Images” selection.
steps.content: Open this sub-folder and double-click on the “Images” selection. Here you should see the file name of the background image you want to save.

steps.title: Open the image in a new browser tab.
steps.content: Open the image in a new browser tab. To do this, right-click on the file name of the background image and select “Open link in a new tab.”

steps.title: Save the image.
steps.content: Save the image. Right-click on the image displayed, and select “Save Image As” from the context menu. The “Save As” dialog box should appear. Enter a name for the background image in the dialog box, and click the “Save” button. The image will now be stored locally in your computer.

steps.title: View the image on your computer’s image-viewing app.
steps.content: View the image on your computer’s image-viewing app. Click on “Documents” on your desktop to open it in a new Explorer window, and select “Downloads” from the directory panel on the left. This will display all the files you’ve saved from the Internet to your computer. Look for the image you’ve just saved and double-click on it to open it on your computer’s image-viewing application.
